Package fr.cnrs.iees.identity

Interface IdentityScope

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IntegerScope, LocalScope, PairLocalScope, ResettableLocalScope, UniversalScope
    public interface IdentityScope
    A scope over which Identities are guaranteed to be unique. Note: every scope has a unique id over the application scope so that merging items from different scopes is always possible
    Author:
    Jacques Gignoux - 28 janv. 2019

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> scopeIds
      This field to make sure all scope instances have a different id

    • Method Detail

      • id

        java.lang.String id()
        returns
        Returns:
        the scope id within the application context

      • newId

        Identity newId()
        makes a new instance of an Identity, unique over this scope. NOTE: implementations of this method should never return null
        Returns:
        a new Identity instance, unique over this scope

      • newId

        default Identity newId​(boolean addToScope,
                       java.lang.String proposedId)
        makes a new instance of an Identity, unique over this scope. The default method ignores the argument. NOTE: implementations of this method should never return null
        Parameters:
        proposedId - a base for the id to be computed
        Returns:
        a new Identity instance, unique over this scope

      • newId

        default Identity newId​(boolean addToScope,
                       java.lang.String... proposedIdComponents)
        makes a new instance of an Identity, unique over this scope. The default method ignores the arguments. NOTE: implementations of this method should never return null
        Parameters:
        proposedIdComponents - a base for the id to be computed
        Returns:
        a new Identity instance, unique over this scope
